summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from March 31, 2021, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of a lawsuit alleging Jeffrey Epstein trafficked a victim and threatened to feed her to alligators, as well as new grooming allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell that expand the timeframe to when Prince Andrew knew Epstein. The bulk of the document covers other topics like Capitol riot investigations, the Chauvin trial, hate crimes, and various criminal investigations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a lawsuit alleging he trafficked a victim, threatened to feed her to alligators, and forced her to undergo vaginal surgery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the same lawsuit as Epstein's purported madam, accused of participating in rape and trafficking. Also referenced regarding new grooming allegations and her upcoming trial.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to new grooming allegations against Maxwell that expand the timeframe to the period when he knew Epstein. His legal team has stressed the DOJ treats him as a witness.

connections.description: Described in a lawsuit as working together to traffic, rape, and threaten a victim. Maxwell is referred to as Epstein's 'purported madam'.
The document notes Prince Andrew was friends with Epstein, and new allegations expand the criminal timeframe to when Andrew knew him.

events.title: Lawsuit Alleges Epstein Trafficking and Mutilation
events.description: A lawsuit is filed by a South Florida real estate broker alleging Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell trafficked her, repeatedly raped her in front of her son, forced her to undergo vaginal surgery, and threatened to feed her to alligators.

events.title: New Grooming Allegations Against Maxwell
events.description: New grooming allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell expand the timeframe of her alleged crimes to 2001-2004, which is the period when Prince Andrew was friends with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A lawsuit contains new, stark allegations against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including forcing a victim to undergo vaginal surgery and threatening to feed her to alligators.
The lawsuit alleges Epstein and Maxwell emphasized Epstein's influence over the FBI, Homeland Security's ICE, and Florida law enforcement to intimidate the victim.
New grooming allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell expand the timeframe of her alleged crimes to 2001-2004, which includes the period when Prince Andrew knew Epstein.
Prince Andrew's legal team has stated the U.S. Department of Justice treats him as a witness, not a target, in the Epstein investigation.
The document is primarily an FBI news briefing covering many other topics; the Epstein-related content is a small subset of the overall report.
